sense.name: a mixture of ingredients
sense.examples: The driveway was a composition of sand and gravel. The composition of this glaze provides a lot of open time for working it over the paint. The cake batter should be a fairly thin composition after you add the milk and fruit juice.

sense.name: the nature, makeup or constitution of something
sense.examples: The social composition of village life is rather different than that of the cities. The composition of the man's frame was sturdy and well-muscled, typical of the men of that region.

sense.name: a spatial arrangement of components
sense.commentary: COMPOSITION[+relation][+spatial][+arrangement][+of_components] Note: refers to the static arrangement, not the act of creating it (Sense 7)
sense.examples: The room's composition was spoiled by an overly-large chair stuck in one corner. His abstract oils exhibit harmonious composition of color and texture across the canvas.

sense.name: an artistic or creative work, e.g.,writing, music, painting
sense.commentary: COMPOSITION[+entity][+creation][+opus][+artistic] Note: refers to the thing itself, not the act of creating it (Sense 5)
sense.examples: The composer has written a new composition for flute and piano. These are early still life compositions by the artist that were drawn in charcoal. The students had to write a 5-page composition for the final exam.

sense.name: the act of creating an artistic work
sense.examples: We watched the composition of sand paintings by local artists at the annual town fair. His composition of that symphony only took five weeks.

sense.name: the craft of typography, typesetting
sense.examples: John learned composition from an old newspaper typesetter. Traditional composition for a daily newspaper was a time-consuming process.

sense.name: the act of arranging components into a unified whole
sense.examples: His composition of a theory from these scanty facts seems quite premature. The composition of an interim government occurred quickly after the coup was thwarted. Mary's composition of the wild flowers into a bridal bouquet was astonishingly fast.

sense.name: a legal settlement of money that replaces a previous debt
sense.examples: The plaintiff agreed to the company's composition of $35,000.
